title: [NETBEANS-3593] Make toolbar browser icon take advantage of improved HiDPI scaling.
body:
Ensure that the HiDPI icon scaling improvements made in NETBEANS-2614 (https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1273) applies to the browser icon. See before/after screenshots.

API change: This adds a public method in DropDownButtonFactory to make the dropdown arrow icon available to other modules.

Also add some missing "since" annotations in the openide.util.ui module.

![browsericon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70831850-97268880-1dc1-11ea-9047-962a27d9f885.png)

title: [NETBEANS-3196] Fix lazy Node loading when switching from Children.LEAF to another Children instance
body:
There's a bug in org.openide.nodes.Node.setChildren(Children). Basically, if Children.LEAF.getNodesCount() is _ever_ called, from any module, then Node implementations that switch from Children.LEAF to another Children implementation will no longer get lazy loading behavior.

(This bug was found in a NetBeans Platform application that relies heavily on lazy loading of nodes. It calls setChildren(Children.LEAF) in order to prevent an an expansion handle from appearing in OutlineView for nodes that are known to have no children, and then calls setChildren again if children later do appear.)

See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3196 for more details.

title: [NETBEANS-3581] Improvements to DropDownButton/DropDownToggleButton
body:
DropDownButton/DropDownToggleButton are most commonly used in the various NetBeans toolbars--there is one pair of DropDownButton buttons in the editor toolbar, for instance.

(I use both DropDownButton and DropDownToggleButton in my NetBeans Platform application, and have tested both there. I have tested DropDownButton in the IDE as well. There are no current uses of DropDownToggleButton in the IDE.)

Details:
* Copy an old bugfix from DropDownButton to DropDownToggleButton (an added
  updateRollover call), to fix a problem where the latter would show the wrong
  icon after an icon change.
* Fix a bug where DropDownButton would occasionally get in a state where two
  mouse clicks were required to open it.
* Prevent dropdown button menus from showing up when the button is disabled.
* If DropDownButton has no action listeners registered, allow the user to click
  anywhere in the button area (not just the arrow area on the side) to open the
  dropdown menu.
* Review all differences between DropDownButton and DropDownToggleButton, and
  make sure they are legitimate. (These two classes are nearly identical, save
  for a few changes.)

![dropdown button examples](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70830207-b3c0c180-1dbd-11ea-8b07-7c3b792cddc3.png)

title: [NETBEANS-3592] Workarounds for JDK Windows LAF bugs on HiDPI screens
body:
Provide workarounds for various JDK bugs that caused the Windows LAF to be unusable on many HiDPI configurations, typically when an external monitor (or projector) is involved, or is disconnected or connected. Summary:

1) Fix tiny or huge GUI font size on various configurations.
2) Fix tiny or huge UI control icons when main monitor was not the HiDPI monitor at logon. (Workaround for https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8211715.)
3) Fix uneven borders on text components on non-integral HiDPI scaling factors (e.g. 150%). (A similar improvement was previously done for the NetBeans tabcontrol borders, see https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1284 .)

See full details on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3592

![Problem 1, incorrect font size](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70829144-e9b07680-1dba-11ea-8d8e-d1a6363064f6.png)
![Problem 2, OS controls wrong size (before patch)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70829142-e9b07680-1dba-11ea-96e1-0dbda87d728c.png)
![Problem 2, OS controls wrong size (after patch)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70829141-e917e000-1dba-11ea-8d72-1d4928dab357.png)
![Problem 3, uneven text component borders](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70829143-e9b07680-1dba-11ea-82b5-619ac3edf1d5.png)
![WindowsSwingMultiMonitorTest](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/70829162-f503a200-1dba-11ea-98e5-faedf16ac917.png)

title: [TRAVIS] Fix core network tests
body:
Fix core network tests when run in a Travis worker. 

Edits `/etc/hosts` to remove hostname in the localhost entry.

Before editing: 
```
## Managed by Chef on packer-5df1faf8-b61a-05e1-6e00-7c129c076cc3.c.eco-emissary-99515.internal :heart_eyes_cat:
## cookbook:: travis_build_environment
##     file:: templates/default/etc/cloud/templates/hosts.tmpl.erb
127.0.1.1 travis-job-adbfb820-92fd-40ed-9452-91ae7fb08218 travis-job-adbfb820-92fd-40ed-9452-91ae7fb08218 ip4-loopback xenial64
127.0.0.1 localhost nettuno travis vagrant travis-job-adbfb820-92fd-40ed-9452-91ae7fb08218 
```

After editing:
```
## File modified by nbbuild/travis/fix_hosts_file.groovy
## Managed by Chef on packer-5df1faf8-b61a-05e1-6e00-7c129c076cc3.c.eco-emissary-99515.internal :heart_eyes_cat:
## cookbook:: travis_build_environment
##     file:: templates/default/etc/cloud/templates/hosts.tmpl.erb
127.0.1.1 travis-job-adbfb820-92fd-40ed-9452-91ae7fb08218 travis-job-adbfb820-92fd-40ed-9452-91ae7fb08218 ip4-loopback xenial64
# 127.0.0.1 localhost nettuno travis vagrant travis-job-adbfb820-92fd-40ed-9452-91ae7fb08218 
127.0.0.1 localhost nettuno travis vagrant 
```

title: [NETBEANS-3428] FlatLaf: UI delegates for editor and view tabs in main window
body:
Editor and view tabs in main window implemented in flat style.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5604048/70626237-59402d80-1c24-11ea-93d0-c6ccabcc9d54.png)

Also added "FlatLaf Light" to LaF combobox in Options.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5604048/70626317-81c82780-1c24-11ea-922a-c5205c995633.png)

The tabs and split dividers scale also on Java 8 (and on Linux) in the same was as FlatLaf scales.

Note: When using non-default document tab options (e.g. left/right/bottom tab placement, multi-row tabs, etc), the editor tabs are shown differently because a different renderer is used, which is not implemented in this PR. These options can be found in Options dialog at "Appearance > Document Tabs".

All tab colors can be configured in [FlatDarkLaf.properties](https://github.com/DevCharly/netbeans/blob/flatlaf-tabs/platform/o.n.swing.laf.flatlaf/src/org/netbeans/swing/laf/flatlaf/FlatDarkLaf.properties#L24-L51) and [FlatLightLaf.properties](https://github.com/DevCharly/netbeans/blob/flatlaf-tabs/platform/o.n.swing.laf.flatlaf/src/org/netbeans/swing/laf/flatlaf/FlatLightLaf.properties#L18-L47).
Colors, insets, etc, which are common to Dark and Light themes are in [FlatLaf.properties](https://github.com/DevCharly/netbeans/blob/flatlaf-tabs/platform/o.n.swing.laf.flatlaf/src/org/netbeans/swing/laf/flatlaf/FlatLaf.properties#L25-L53).

These three `.properties` files are detected by FlatLaf using a service loader.

Values starting with `@@` (in the `.properties` files) are references to other values. They may come from FlatLaf core `.properties` files: https://github.com/JFormDesigner/FlatLaf/tree/master/flatlaf-core/src/main/resources/com/formdev/flatlaf

title: [NETBEANS-3552] - Upgrade GraalVM from 19.0.0 to 19.3.0
body:
Notes:
- Added support for date, time, timezone and duration values in polyglot
- Better sub-process control
- Improved FileSystem management
- Updated Node.js to version 12.10.0
- Added support for reading environment variables
- Improved debugger
- Added support for temporary files and directories

Notes for ICU4J:
- Java 7 as minimum runtime
- Support Unicode 12.1
- Support CLDR 36 (Unicode Common Locale Data Repository)


[GraalVM Web Page](https://www.graalvm.org/)
[GraalVM SDK Release Notes](https://github.com/oracle/graal/blob/master/sdk/CHANGELOG.md)
[GraalJS Release Notes](https://github.com/graalvm/graaljs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
[GraalVM Truffle Release Notes](https://github.com/oracle/graal/blob/master/truffle/CHANGELOG.md)
[ICU4J Release Notes](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/releases/)

title: [NETBEANS-3551] - Upgrade Apache Commons-IO from 1.4 to 2.6
body:
Notes:
- Requires JDK 1.7 or later
- Compatibility with Java 9 module system
- Many fixed bugs
- Improved performance
- Deprecate `Charsets Charset` constants in favor of Java 7's `java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets`
- All `closeQuietly` overloads in `org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils` have been deprecated. Use the `try-with-resources` statement or handle suppressed exceptions manually.
- The class `org.apache.commons.io.FileSystemUtils` has been deprecated. Use equivalent methods in `java.nio.file.FileStore instead`.

[Apache Commons-IO Web Page](https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/)
[Apache Commons-IO Release Notes](https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/upgradeto2_6.html)

title: [NETBEANS-3542] - cleanup unchecked conversion warnings..
body:
There are a LOT of the following warnings in the build..

   [repeat] /home/bwalker/src/netbeans/platform/openide.filesystems/src/org/netbeans/modules/openide/filesystems/declmime/MIMEResolverProcessor.java:190: warning: [unchecked] unchecked conversion
   [repeat]         Set<String> s = new TreeSet();
   [repeat]                         ^
   [repeat]   required: Set<String>
   [repeat]   found:    TreeSet

This change cleans up many of these.. But, it's not complete as there are so many of them..

The best solution to the problem is to avoid querying lookup from `org.netbeans.core.startup.TopLogging$LookupDel.publish` which is what this PR provides.

title: Updating to HTML/Java API version 1.7
body:
Time to update to new version of HTML/Java API which has been released in November.

OracleLab's IGV is currently using 1.6.1 (bundled together with NetBeans 11.2) and we run into a GC related problem of premature release of the model objects: [fix by this change](https://github.com/apache/netbeans-html4j/commit/cd3229252279ee02de13230909393f88cb5de18e).

The fix is part of NetBeans HTML/Java API version 1.7 - hence upgrading to it (in NetBeans as well as IGV) shall fix our problems.

title: [NETBEANS-3411] Added support for reading Kotlin based Gradle projects.
body:
Changed the order of mime resolvers: <xml based>, <service registered> -> <service registered>, <xml based> 
Right now I have 93 xml based registrations and only 2 service regs: Docker and Gradle+Kotlin
I think it might be better to comb them together in a single ordered list, but as most probably you register a mime resolver as service when the xml based is not enough or mask something, I think putting the service registered ones in the front is not a bad thing. Also it might be better just to add a registered service based mime resolver for the xml based stuff and only use the service based ones with their specified ordering.

title: [NETBEANS-3531] - Upgrade GraalVM SDK from 19.0.0 to 19.3.0
body:
Notes:
- Added support for date, time, timezone and duration values in polyglot
- Better sub-process control
- Improved FileSystem management
- Many more...

[GraalVM SDK Web Page](https://www.graalvm.org/)

[GraalVM SDK Release Notes](https://github.com/oracle/graal/blob/master/sdk/CHANGELOG.md)

title: [NETBEANS-3530] - Upgrade GraalJS from 19.0.0 to 19.3.0
body:
Notes:
- Added support for date and time interop
- Updated ASM library to version 7.1.
- Updated Node.js to version 12.10.0.
- Many more...

[GraalJS Web Page](https://github.com/graalvm/graaljs)

[GraalJS Release Notes](https://github.com/graalvm/graaljs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)

title: [NETBEANS-3529] - Upgrade GraalVM Truffle from 19.0.0 to 19.3.0
body:
Notes:
- Added support for reading environment variables
- Deprecated many methods
- Improved debugger
- Added support for temporary files and directories

[GraalVM Truffle Web Page](https://github.com/oracle/graal/tree/master/truffle)

[GraalVM Truffle Release Notes](https://github.com/oracle/graal/blob/master/truffle/CHANGELOG.md)

title: [NETBEANS-3525] - Upgrade Apache Lucene from 3.5.0 to 3.6.2
body:
Notes;
- In addition to Java 5 and Java 6, this release has now full Java 7 support (minimum JDK 7u1 required).
- Many bug fixes
- Security fixes
- Improved performance

[Apache Lucene Web Page](https://lucene.apache.org/core/)
[Apache Lucene Releases](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/LUCENE?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page&status=released)
- [Apache Lucene Release Notes 3.6.0](https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/lucene-general/201204.mbox/%3CCAOdYfZVLVvs392LDt5X0XvxT3V%2Ba0Y%2BORwNGfJpjBuBC0gFSAQ%40mail.gmail.com%3E)
- [Apache Lucene Release Notes 3.6.1](https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/lucene-general/201207.mbox/%3C010a01cd6811%2422d72430%2468856c90%24%40apache.org%3E)
- [Apache Lucene Release Notes 3.6.2](https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/lucene-general/201212.mbox/%3CCAOdYfZVtM21W%3DfKe8D82fCpKhrMEBBo7QjjmgZrp-tMv7stQhA%40mail.gmail.com%3E)

title: [NETBEANS-3524] - Upgrade ICU4J from 62.1 to 65.1
body:
Notes for ICU4J:
- Java 7 as minimum runtime
- Support Unicode 12.1
- Support CLDR 36 (Unicode Common Locale Data Repository)

[ICU4J Web Page](http://site.icu-project.org/)
[ICU4J Release Notes](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/releases/)

title: [NETBEANS-3523] - Upgrade Apache XML-RPC from 3.0 to 3.1.3
body:
Notes:
- 37 Fixed Bugs
- 14 New Features

[Apache XML-RPC Web Page](https://ws.apache.org/xmlrpc/index.html)
[Apache XML-RPC Release Notes](https://ws.apache.org/xmlrpc/changes-report.html)

title: [NETBEANS-3522] - Upgrade Apache commons-codec from 1.3 to 1.13
body:
Notes:
- Requires Java 1.7
- Add methods for SHA-3, SHA-224, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512
- Improved testing suite, performance and documentation
- Many Security fixes
- 67 Fixed Bugs
- 59 New Features
- 1 Removed Method (NetBeans does not use it):
   - Base64.discardWhitespace(byte[])

[Apache Commons-Codec Web Page](https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/)
[Apache Commons-Codec Release Notes](https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/changes-report.html)

title: [NETBEANS-3521] - Upgrade Xerces2-J from 2.8.0 to 2.12.0
body:
Notes:
- Fixed several bugs 
- Many enhancements and performance improvements
- Xerces and Xalan now share a common serialization codebase
- Xerces' native serializer was deprecated
- Support for OASIS XML Catalogs v1.1
- Implementation of the parser related portions of JAXP 1.4
- Experimental support for XML Schema 1.1 by providing a fully compliant XML Schema 1.1 implementation

[Apache Xerces2-J Web Page](https://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/)
[Apache Xerces2-J Release Notes](https://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/releases.html)

title: More stabilization of the vanilla javac indexer.
body: This increases stability of indexing without nb-javac when there are errors in the source code - in particular when some classes are missing. Before, this lead to more exceptions/broken caches.

labels.name: Java
labels.description: [ci] enable extra Java tests (java.completion, java.source.base, java.hints, refactoring.java, form)

* cast,
* deprecation,
* rawtypes and

JEDDICT-322 Add Jeddict modules to friend-packages
body:
Replacement of PR https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1405 with only friend request commits.
And creating the separate PR for Public API/SPI request.

title: [NETBEANS-3512] Fixed compiler warnings concerning rawtypes ActionStub
body:
There are compiler warnings about rawtype usage with ActionStub like the following
```
 [nb-javac] .../platform/spi.actions/test/unit/src/org/netbeans/spi/actions/ContextActionTest.java:732: warning: [rawtypes] found raw type: ActionStub
 [nb-javac]         Reference<ActionStub> outerStubRef = new WeakReference<ActionStub>(a.stub);
 [nb-javac]                                                                ^
 [nb-javac]   missing type arguments for generic class ActionStub<T>
 [nb-javac]   where T is a type-variable:
 [nb-javac]     T extends Object declared in class ActionStub
```
The aim is to change the code such that these warnings are no longer emitted by the compiler.

```
   [repeat]     private static Pattern getHightlightPattern(IssueTable issueTable, IssueProperty p) {
   [repeat]                                                                        ^
   [repeat]   missing type arguments for generic class IssueNode<I>.IssueProperty<T>
   [repeat]   where T,I are type-variables:
   [repeat]     T extends Object declared in class IssueNode.IssueProperty
   [repeat]     I extends Object declared in class IssueNode
```
The aim is to change the code such that these warnings are no longer emitted by the compiler.

title: [NETBEANS-3428] FlatLaf: Fixed colors of categories buttons in Options dialog
body:
Simple fix for Options dialog categories button colors.

Uses existing colors from UI defaults.
So this should also work fine with other FlatLaf themes.

The magnifier left to the quick search field is hard to see, but this should be fixed with a SVG icon.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5604048/69893283-8b41bd80-130f-11ea-8e8f-f19b5b0152c2.png)

body: rrent compilation unit, when nb-javac is not installed.

title: [NETBEANS-3497] Allow LaF to prefer a color profile
[TRAVIS] Remove timeouts for platform/api.htmlui tests
[NETBEANS-3428] Moved flatlaf into a library wrapper module.
[NETBEANS-3428] Update FlatLaf from 0.18 to 0.20
body:
Hi there, I'm Karl, creator of FlatLaf. This is my first (but not last) PR. Hope it is OK  

This PR updates FlatLaf to 0.20, which includes following fixes/improvements for NetBeans:

- ComboBox: Fixed issues with NetBeans `org.openide.awt.ColorComboBox`
  component.
- Fixed color of links in HTML text.
- Button: Make button square if button text is "..." or a single character.
- Look and feel identifier returned by `FlatLaf.getID()` now always starts with
  "FlatLaf". Use `UIManager.getLookAndFeel().getID().startsWith( "FlatLaf" )` to
  check whether the current look and feel is FlatLaf.

Here is a full list of changes: https://github.com/JFormDesigner/FlatLaf/releases/tag/0.20
